info.headline: Air Stagnation Advisory issued January 01 at 8:37AM PST until January 03 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Boise
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...For the Dense Fog Advisory, visibility of one quarter mile or less in dense fog. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, an extended period of stagnant air, with light winds and little vertical mixing. * WHERE...In Idaho, Lower Treasure Valley ID. In Oregon, Oregon Lower Treasure Valley. * WHEN...For the Dense Fog Advisory, until 1 PM MST this afternoon. For the Air Stagnation Advisory, until 8 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. Periods of air stagnation can lead to the buildup of pollutants near the surface.
info.instruction: If driving, slow down, use your headlights, and leave plenty of distance ahead of you. An Air Stagnation Advisory concerns itself with meteorological conditions only. For more information on air pollution in Idaho, visit website www.deq.idaho.gov. For Oregon, visit website www.oregon.gov/deq. If possible, reduce or eliminate activities that contribute to air pollution, such as outdoor burning, and the use of residential wood burning devices. Reduce vehicle trips and vehicle idling as much as possible.
